item.title: Client.java problems
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:1, topic:496602”]Hi, i maked a simple java file called memberShipHandler every thing works fine untill i am making a “client c = new client();”
then i tried to use it like this :
c.sendMessage(“NLAVBLABALA”);
then i open the client java file and add this memberShipHandler msh = new memberShipHandler();
and then i added a command
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“Member”)){
msh.checkMember();//One of the voids in the file.
}
all works fine then i get an error:

memberShipHandler.java:4: cannot find symbol
symbol : constructor client()
location: class client
client c = new client();
^
1 error
what is the problem?[/quote]
At First

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("Member")){ //1 Problem You forget to put a space after ")) if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("Member"))_{ msh.checkMember(); }
And Second, You dont need client c variable for making a command at commands.java Well make sure you have This public void playerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) at commands (In Playercommand section) Just delete that client c; shit
and just add the command

Read full topic

item.title: Client.java problems
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Hi, i maked a simple java file called memberShipHandler every thing works fine untill i am making a “client c = new client();”
then i tried to use it like this :
c.sendMessage(“NLAVBLABALA”);
then i open the client java file and add this memberShipHandler msh = new memberShipHandler();
and then i added a command
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“Member”)){
msh.checkMember();//One of the voids in the file.
}
all works fine then i get an error:

memberShipHandler.java:4: cannot find symbol
symbol : constructor client()
location: class client
client c = new client();
^
1 error
what is the problem?

Read full topic
